description: Enterprise techniques used by FakeM, ATT&CK software S0076 v1.1
name: FakeM (S0076)

techniques.comment: FakeM C2 traffic attempts to evade detection by resembling data generated by legitimate messenger applications, such as MSN and Yahoo! messengers. Additionally, some variants of FakeM use modified SSL code for communications back to C2 servers, making SSL decryption ineffective.[1]

The original variant of FakeM encrypts C2 traffic using a custom encryption cipher that uses an XOR key of "YHCRA" and bit rotation between each XOR operation. Some variants of FakeM use RC4 to encrypt C2 traffic.[1]
Some variants of FakeM use SSL to communicate with C2 servers.[1]
